__e: I can't explain it, but it feels right being here with you.
And I can't explain it... but there's something about the way he's saying it.
I can't explain it. My heart is telling me to believe them.
I just... I needed a way to explain it to my husband.
Okay, uh, obviously I know exactly what's going on, but for the sake of these people, uh, maybe you should explain?
Well, I'd like to see you explain that to my dead friend, George! Anyway,
It was a, uh... A miracle. There's no other way to explain it.
I think I should let you know before we begin-- and I'll try to be fast here-- uh, that I have been in a lot of therapy myself.
You're feeling that you've failed, that you have to explain this somehow.
But if you need to explain it to your men, I understand.
I suddenly realized if we did, I'd have no way of explaining this to my parents.
He said usually the best way to explain it to the parents is to say that Mother Nature made a mistake.
If it' all the same to you, sergeant I'd like to explain that to my commanding officer in Washington.
But in a case like this, couldn't you explain it to the C.O.?
That's right. And you could explain all of this to your boss back home. Probably even keep your job.
I would've never been able to explain that to the police.
That's beyond your abilities. Oh, I know that, and I tried to explain it to my naive younger self, but she wouldn't listen.
When are you gonna come back, explain it to the cops?
